result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin Alex Picchietti

records.addlTxt:
10:33 AM Defendant Justin Alex Picchietti in court.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman appeared by video for Justin Alex Picchietti.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  Attny Chapman  acknowledges information, waives reading.  DEF enters NG plea.  Court finds probable cause and binds DEF over for trial.    Court reviews Justice Point violation report.   Attny Chapman makes statement.  DEF makes statement.  State makes statement.  Court directs DEF to follow bond conditions.  Justice Point Representative K. Dussl, makes statement.  Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.
Status conference scheduled for January 3, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on January 3, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Document Number 14 was erased, due to filing incorrect Report - Justice Point

11:33 AM Defendant Justin Alex Picchietti in court.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman appeared by video for Justin Alex Picchietti.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  Atty Chapman waived prelim.  Court advised the DEF as to his right to prelim.  DEF does not wish to have prelim.  Court finds defendant freely waived his right to prelim finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.  Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.
Arraignment scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on September 2, 2022 at 11:30 am.

COURT: SIB $2500  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.

9:01 AM DE Justin Picchietti in court without an attorney. Kenneth Sortedahl appeared in person for the State of WI.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  DE verifies DOB and Address. Court recites the charges and penalties DE does not qualify for public defender.  Court finds probable cause.  State makes bond recommendation.  Defendant has no objection. DEF wishes to set the preliminary hearing within the time limits. Court sets bond.   Court gives the DE the attorney colloquy.
